name: roast
content:
roast verb
(COOK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 [ T or I ] to cook food in an oven or over a fire: Just roast the chicken in the oven and baste it in oil and lemon.figurative We lay on the beach and roasted (= got very hot) in the Mediterranean sun.
[ T or I ] to heat nuts or coffee beans so that they become drier and browner
More examplesFewer examplesI roasted the vegetables with some olive oil.Have these red peppers been roasted?Roast the lamb in a hot oven for 45 minutes.I roasted a few nuts.We roasted chestnuts on the open fire.

roast verb
(CRITICIZE)
[ T ] informal to criticize severely or speak angrily to someone: Critics roasted him for exploiting racial stereotypes.
[ T ] mainly US, informal to humorously criticize and make jokes about a famous person at a public event honouring that person, as a part of the event: He's known for roasting big-name celebrities on his Comedy Central shows.
